review: Trying to search for a Netflix movie or Youtube stream using your Blu Ray player's remote is a frustrating experience that has one wishing one could use a keyboard. With Chromecast, it's possible. I use my laptop to find the Netflix movie or Youtube stream I want to watch, start it running, click on the Chromecast icon built into the Netflix or Youtube tab or window, and the Chromecast device takes over. Movies and streams run at the same quality had you used the clunky remote to find and start them.This is the only way I run Netflix and Youtube now. And in case you're wondering, you can go on and open another window and check email, search the web, or do anything else and your movie will keep on running.I don't use Hulu and I think whether videos from other sources run well is probably hit and miss. Read other reviews for more info on that aspect.A real keyboard is much better than a virtual keyboard and a remote.I had a little trouble getting set up and running, but I got very competent help from Amazon telephone customer service  and soon had things going. I probably missed something in the documentation.$35 well spent as far as I'm concerned.
author: UnseenWorld

review: Pretty easy to set up. After initial set up, get other ipad, iphone, mac or PC, or tablet connected is easy.This thing works as a wifi receiver and stream video player, your pad, iphone, mac or PC, or tablet works as remote control. The good thing is your pad, iphone, mac or PC, or tablet can then be freed to do something else when your chrome cast is playing by itself.The not so great thing is there will be a delay in playing, you have to wait for a few second for it to start. WHen you are watching serial show, you have to start the show for each new episode.Also not great is that it won't play your stored video, of course, this you should know when you purchase it. I have no regret. I may buy another one if I need in the future, or maybe I can try a different one.
